title: How France's fixation with decline serves the Trumpian narrative
subhead: As the threat posed by the United States grows, narratives of decline have gained traction in France, setting the stage for a presidential campaign centered on the power of France and Europe.

title: Morgue near Tehran overwhelmed by bodies amid protest crackdown

Quinn Slobodian: 'The US discarding the post-1945 international system is a bold and reckless gamble'
subhead: The Trump administration stubbornly believes that the only way for the US to regain its lost greatness is through regional, rather than global, supremacy, analyzes the specialist in global history.

title: NATO, Greenland vow to boost Arctic security after Trump threats
subhead: Following President Trump's threat on Sunday to take Greenland 'one way or another,' NATO and Greenland's government are intending to strengthen the territory's defense.

title: Real Madrid fires Xabi Alonso and names Alvaro Arbeloa as coach
subhead: Real Madrid parted ways with the Spanish coach and named former defender Alvaro Arbeloa as his replacement, a day after losing the Spanish Super Cup final to Barcelona.

title: Exclusive images: On the set of 'Marty Supreme,' Timothée Chalamet dominates the game
subhead: In 'Marty Supreme,' directed by Josh Safdie, Timothée Chalamet plays Marty Mauser, a character inspired by the 1950s table tennis star Marty Reisman. With a Golden Globe win, the role cements the 30-year-old as one of the greatest actors of his generation. Photographer Tim El Kaïm had exclusive access to the set of this highly anticipated film, which is set for release in France in February.

The British seniors trading tea dances at a daring cabaret
subhead: Once a month at London's The Posh Club, burlesque acts and striptease in a nightclub atmosphere delight Brits over 60, who let loose until late in the afternoon.

title: The new luxury olive oils: 'Visitors come with the same curiosity as for wine'
subhead: Olive oil has gained a new status. Championed by Michelin-starred chefs, the ingredient is now treated with the same reverence as a fine vintage wine, reflecting a precious artisanal craft. A handful of French estates are distinguishing themselves, selling their extra virgin production at premium prices.

title: France enjoys another banner year for tourism, buoyed by campgrounds and international visitors
subhead: International tourism revenue rose by 9% in France in 2025, according to the United Nations World Tourism Organization.
